alert.note: Alert for Grady; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 19 at 9:32AM EDT until June 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT FOR COOK...SOUTHERN GRADY...SOUTHWESTERN BERRIEN...THOMAS...BROOKS... EASTERN COLQUITT...TIFT AND SOUTHEASTERN WORTH COUNTIES... At 932 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles west of Sparks to 7 miles southwest of Boston to 11 miles west of Monticello, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Tifton, Moultrie, Adel, Thomasville, Quitman, Sparks, Boston, Omega, Norman Park, Lenox, Ty Ty, Pavo, Coolidge, Phillipsburg, Unionville, Morven, Berlin, Barwick, Cecil and Ellenton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
